title: How to Make a Pantry Raid Stir Fry

steps.headline: Prepare the meat element, if you use it.
steps.description: Slice the meat, clean the shrimp, or dice the tofu. This takes the longest to cook. Judge the time it takes to cook by the time it would take the vegetables to cook or finish cooking. If you're using shrimp, you want to start off by cleaning them and taking the tails off. Don't pre-cook them unless the other elements will be done very quickly.

steps.headline: Cook the noodles separately.
steps.description: Boil the water and prepare the noodles as normal. When done, add a small amount of olive oil to keep from sticking and toss.

steps.headline: Heat the vegetables.
steps.description: Steam or sauté the veggies until they are almost done.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables to the cooked meat and stir in the noodles.
Slice the meat, clean the shrimp, or dice the tofu.
steps.description: It's leftovers, so it should be pre-cooked. Place into a skillet and heat with a small amount of water or light oil.

steps.headline: Steep the Ramen noodles.
steps.description: Drain and put into a bowl with a small amount of olive oil to keep from sticking and toss. When the meat is warmed, add in to the skillet.

steps.headline: Microwave the frozen veggies.
steps.description: When the vegetables are almost done, add to the cooked meat.

text: Steps Prepare the meat element, if you use it. Slice the meat, clean the shrimp, or dice the tofu. This takes the longest to cook. Judge the time it takes to cook by the time it would take the vegetables to cook or finish cooking. If you're using shrimp, you want to start off by cleaning them and taking the tails off. Don't pre-cook them unless the other elements will be done very quickly. Cook the noodles separately. Boil the water and prepare the noodles as normal. When done, add a small amount of olive oil to keep from sticking and toss. Heat the vegetables. Steam or sauté the veggies until they are almost done. Add the vegetables to the cooked meat and stir in the noodles. Cook until hot. Ramen Noodle Method Slice the meat, clean the shrimp, or dice the tofu. It's leftovers, so it should be pre-cooked. Place into a skillet and heat with a small amount of water or light oil. Steep the Ramen noodles. Drain and put into a bowl with a small amount of olive oil to keep from sticking and toss. When the meat is warmed, add in to the skillet. Microwave the frozen veggies. When the vegetables are almost done, add to the cooked meat. Heat until suitable and serve.
